group_1.textCenter: Whether you accept the oath or not,
I vow to swear myself before the gods@on behalf of my village.

group_1.textRight: Ugh…I can't…

group_1.textLeft: If that's the case, maybe you oughta@skedaddle?

group_1.textRight: Nngh…but…

group_1.textLeft: There's no need.
As the daughter of the lord of Hokuyo,@I shall be the one to take this oath.

group_1.textRight: But Princess…!

group_1.textLeft: Have no fear.@I am a Battle Shamaness.

group_1.textRight: I apologize…@I'm not worthy…!

group_1.textLeft: Now then, when shall we set the date?

group_1.textRight: How about we do it in seven days?

group_1.textLeft: Very well.

group_1.textRight: Hey, Tsuyu, why'd you go taking@that guy's place?
Why don't they just do the oaths themselves@and let the gods sort it out?

group_1.textLeft: Are you aware of what an iron-branded oath is?

group_1.textRight: …No?

group_1.textLeft: That's what I assumed…
Once you know, you'll understand@why he was so hesitant.

group_1.textRight: Huh…?

group_1.textLeft: The trial is incredibly dangerous.
First, each contender's oath is written on a seal,@which is placed in the palms of their hands.
A block of red-hot iron is then set@atop the oath.

group_1.textRight: What?! That's just plain stupid…!

group_1.textLeft: Each contender then carries the iron@in their hands to the shrine.
The one with less severe burns is judged@to be the one telling the truth.

group_1.textRight: …Goddamn.
No wonder that farmer wimped out.
And that explains why you stepped up@instead, Tsuyu.
With your powers as a Battle Shamaness,@any injuries you get aren't a big deal.

group_1.textLeft: Indeed.
I can't just sit idly by and let that man's hands@be destroyed.

group_1.textRight: And then the Mizuna farmers will be safe.

group_1.textLeft: But I won't stop at victory alone.

group_1.textRight: That should be enough to resolve things,@though.

group_1.textLeft: No. I'm going to take things one step further…

group_1.textRight: I see. They take issue with our territorial@boundaries.

group_1.textLeft: Yes…
So I wanted to consult with you and see@if you could take action on something.

group_1.textRight: We have a good relationship with@our neighbors.
As long as things don't get out of hand,@I doubt this incident will cause friction.
So what would you have me do, Tsuyu?

group_1.textLeft: The famine is the same there as it is here.
I was hoping you could confirm the situation@and make a proposal…
